alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 11:39AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River at Ashton affecting Spink County. James River at Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Ashton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, water overtops the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton. At 19.0 feet, water reaches the bottom of the bridge 2 miles south and 1 mile east of Ashton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM CDT Thursday was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 19.5 feet Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon.
